title: Georgia teen shot and killed after his hunting party mistook him for a deer
text:
Man who died in Yellowstone fall was hunting for treasure millionaire says he buried

After realizing Lane was shot, the hunting party called police to take him to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

Family members remembered the 17-year-old as a sportsman who enjoyed being in nature.

AD

“[Bobby] was a very avid hunter and fisherman who loved the outdoors,” Michael Rawling, who identified himself as Lane’s cousin, wrote on a GoFundMe page set up to help the family pay funeral expenses.

AD

A deadly deer disease is spreading. Could it strike people, too?

It’s unclear whether charges will be filed in the incident, but the Georgia Department of Natural Resources investigation could possibly lead to an illegal weapons charge, according to Mark McKinnon, a spokesman for Georgia’s DNR Law Enforcement Division.

Georgia is in the midst of bowhunting season for deer; firearm hunting doesn’t begin in the state until Oct. 19.

The firearm “will play into the investigation,” McKinnon told The Washington Post on Monday. “Our critical incident re-creation team is reconstructing the incident — just like you would a fatal car crash. They’ll take measurements, look at angles and they’ll determine what happened.”

AD

Despite Lane’s death, McKinnon said firearm incidents while hunting are relatively rare in Georgia.

“Most hunting accidents we have, and most fatalities we have, are from falling from tree stands. Those are much more common than shooter incidents,” McKinnon said.
